title: Improving data participation for the development of artificial intelligence in dermatology.
details: AR de Luzuriaga - Clinics in Dermatology, 2024
abstract: Artificial intelligence (AI) has the potential to significantly impact many aspects of dermatology. The visual nature of dermatology lends itself to innovations in this space. The robustness of AI algorithms depends on the quality, quantity, and variety …

title: Scaling text de-identification using locally augmented ensembles
details: K Murugadoss, S Kilamsetty, D Doddahonnaiah, N Iyer… - medRxiv, 2024
abstract: The natural language text in electronic health records (EHRs), such as clinical notes, often contains information that is not captured elsewhere (eg, degree of disease progression and responsiveness to treatment) and, thus, is invaluable for …

title: Comparison of Three Deep Learning Models in Accurate Classification of 770 Dermoscopy Skin Lesion Images
details: A Adebiyi, P Rao, J Hirner, A Anokhin, EH Smith… - AMIA Summits on …, 2024
abstract: Accurately determining and classifying different types of skin cancers is critical for early diagnosis. In this work, we propose a novel use of deep learning for classification of benign and malignant skin lesions using dermoscopy images. We …
